div.p: IP of pairs of one anion and one solvent molecule with respect to the isolated species. Bars represent the average over 30 configurations of each pair, with the x-axis showing the anion and the color indicating the solvent used (blue: DMSO; green: DME; orange: PC; red: ACN; gray: isolated anion). Values for the isolated species ( y-axis for the solvent, gray bar for the anion) are averaged over 50 configurations. Dashed bars represent constant shifts δ = 2.8 eV (drawn for pairs where the solvent is oxidized). IPs are well approximated by Eq. ( 1): the smaller of anion IP or the solvent IP minus δ
